attributes.action: Introduce more tax for Buy To Let Landlords and Foreign Property Investors
attributes.background:
Homes are for living in, they are not pension pots. Prices are now ridiculous, driven up by greedy investors. Politicians fear losing elections if house prices fall, yet high prices do not even benefit them either.
Bring down house prices now!
attributes.additional_details:
Wages not in line with rising house prices. Drastic change is needed.
The entire economy should not be functioning on house prices.

attributes.action: Ban the giving of goldfish as prizes at fairgrounds in the UK.
attributes.background: All over the UK fairgrounds and similar events are still giving away goldfish as prizes, this is an outdated practice that needs to be banned as these fish are kept in poor condition and it goes against all the work that goes into educating the public on how to properly look after their fish.
attributes.additional_details: Goldfish have a long life span, require a large volume of water to swim around in and also consume a large amount of oxygen. These fish grow to a large size when fully grown (around 36cm) and also produce a lot of waste compared to many other species available in the aquarium trade. It is universally accepted that one common goldfish needs at least 70 litres on its own with a bigger tank always being better and goldfish as prizes only adds to the problem of people thinking they are expendable.

attributes.action: Ban pictures of children from online dating/sexual encounter profiles
attributes.background: At present it isn't illegal to put pictures of your children on dating websites/apps intended to facilitate sexual meets. There is nothing the police or social services can do if this occurs and persons use pictures of their children to aid their dating breaching the child's rights/privacy+safety.
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother who has recently had her children recognised in the street due to the father using pics of the children on online sex apps I want change.

I have spoken to the police and social services and it isn't an offence to use pictures on these post 18 sites.

It is illegal for children to have social media yet parents can put them in the public domain to help obtain sexual partners.

Legally! Please can we act together to get this discussed in parliament - children's safety is critical!

attributes.action: child sex offenders not be allowed to apply for contact with their own children
attributes.background: After so many families having to deal with their child being sexually abused, I think that no family should have the added pressures and stress of the abusers applying for contact with any child they have parental responsibility for until investigations completed and sentences have been spent.
attributes.additional_details: 80% of child sexual abuse victims under 16 are abused by a family friend, family member or a person known to the family. These child sex offenders have a "right" to apply for contact with children they have parental responsibility for. This is wrong and change MUST happen now!!

attributes.action: Make parking on pavement illegal so we wheelchair and pramchairs get through
attributes.background: When people have parked on pavement. We,  disabled with all sorts of wheelchair  can't get through to the narrow gap between the pavement and wall on the narrow street. That's including all sorts of pushchairs and pramchairs. So make it illegal by parking their cars on pavement anywhere in the UK

attributes.action: Government to demonstrate U.K. will be better off prior to triggering Article 50
attributes.background: The EU referendum resulted in mass country divide with origins from substandard facts. To reassure the UK, the government must publicise robust data & timeframes to prove the UK will be better off (short & long term) including, GDP, inflation, employment, human rights & national security

attributes.action: Increase income tax by 1% and use it to boost NHS funding only.
attributes.background: We are aware that the NHS is facing difficult times.We are fortunate that is has fantastic infrastructure employing a wealth of skilled workers. The NHS directly benefits all of us. Even those with private health insurance employ staff relying on the NHS. We will all benefit from a strong NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
When we or our loved ones are sick, we need the support of the health service and we value the skill and commitment of staff. Nobody likes to wait for hours for appointments, test results or operations, but the service is under strain. The range of treatments is vast and the population is growing.
Every penny each of us puts into the NHS is a way of looking after ourselves and those we love.
Let's have an NHS to feel proud of. I am happy to have two less Starbucks a week to make this happen.

attributes.action: A Parliamentary review of the 2005 Change to the Double Jeopardy Law.
attributes.background: We believe the operation of the change in the the DJ law is not working as Parliament intended. We cite the example of Matthew Hamlen, a 37 year old electrician, and a married man with a son, currently in the custody of HMPS in the UK having been sentenced to 30 years imprisonment in February 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
Matthew has strenuously and consistently denied any involvement both before and during his original trial in 2011/2012 , at which he was unanimously acquitted by the jury, and his later ‘double jeopardy’ trial in January and Feb  2016.

https://matthewhamlenisinnocent.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to work a shift on A&E explaining to patients why he's failed us all
attributes.background: We think that Jeremy Hunt should work a shift in any overcrowded A&E Department this winter and go round to every patient, nurse, doctor, ambulance crew and explain how he prepared for this winter and how he's failed us all.

attributes.action: Create a database for those who would like to remain EU citizens after Brexit
attributes.background: The EU referendum shows that 48.11% of voters chose to remain in the EU. Many people who didn't vote have since said that they wish to remain, plus 'Brexiters' who claim to have been misinformed. Give the EU an exact figure of people willing to keep their citizenship if it were offered to them.
attributes.additional_details: The European Parliament's chief negotiator has confirmed that EU negotiators will offer Brits an individual opt-in to remain EU citizens. Show that we want this deal and that Teresa May does NOT speak for us, we speak for ourselves!

attributes.action: Change the legal rights to identifying information regarding adoptions.
attributes.background:
Due to the UK Adoption Laws birth families have no legal rights to identifying information regarding adoptions. 
The only options is to use an Intermediary Agent or to place your name on the Adoption Contact Register hoping the adoptee has already put their name on it, or will do in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to change these laws so that birth families can access the details of their adopted children/siblings.
We propose the following;
The birth family to be able to obtain the  adoption certificate, which shows the name the adoptee, was given after adoption including the adoptive parents names.
County the adoption occurred.
In the first instance the biological parents can obtain these documents.
Siblings to also have the rights to apply for the same information.

attributes.action: Stop the UK from recognising child marriage conducted abroad as legal.
attributes.background:
The UK recognises child marriage provided they were conducted "legally" abroad & also for benefit purposes.
It is illegal to marry under 18 yrs of age in the UK (16 years with parental consent) & these child marriages should not be recognised by the UK in any form. The adult should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details:
Today Save the Children estimated that a girl marries under the age of 15 years every 7 second seconds within the world.
In recognising the child marriages of immigrants to the UK (including for benefit purposes) we do nothing to stop this child abuse.

attributes.action: Make sex work a protected characteristic under the Equality Act
attributes.background: The 2010 Equality Act does not include sex workers e.g. escorts, strippers, and porn actors, as a protected characteristic. Former sex workers can be discriminated against at work e.g. teachers may be fired if their past is exposed, despite it not impacting their ability to do their job.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of sex workers are also women, LGBT+ (particularly transgender), disabled or belong to an ethnic minority. While these characteristics are protected, the fact that a disproportionate amount of sex workers belong to vulnerable groups means that they are still indirectly disadvantaged in the workplace.

For more info on sex work in the UK: http://prostitutescollective.net/

The Equality Act and discrimination:
https://www.gov.uk/discrimination-your-rights/types-of-discrimination

attributes.action: Make sign language compulsory from infants at school.
attributes.background: Anyone can become deaf in their lifetime. Surely if more people can sign language people that are deaf or people with special needs adhd or autism that use forms of signs such as makaton to communicate won't feel so isolated.
attributes.additional_details: Children are like a sponge when soaking up knowledge. So if makaton which is an easier form.of sign language is introduced to children at a young age, it would mean that we would eventually all be able to.communicate at some point in life with someone who uses sign language every day. It means future generations can go ask that child thats sat on their own in the playground to come and play with them. They will be able to.communicate, instead of not knowing how to and the child not left isolated no more.

attributes.action: Pressure Myanmar's government to stop the genocide against the Rohingya people
attributes.background: Decades of discrimination and dehumanisation of the Rohingya, an ethnic minority in Myanmar, has ultimately led to genocidal violence from political and religious leaders since 2012, which "may amount to crimes against humanity". The country's leader, a Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, sits idly by.
attributes.additional_details:
Described by the UN as "the world's most persecuted minority", the Rohingya are an ethnic minority who have lived in Myanmar's Arakan state for generations. They were stripped of citizenship in 1982 and are victims of gross human rights violations.

We urge the UK government to pressure the Myanmar government to:
•Allow humanitarian and medical aid into the affected areas
•Allow the UN unrestricted access to conduct their investigations
•Recognise Rohingya as an official ethnic minority

attributes.action: Stop plans to pay for the restoration of properties belonging to the super rich.
attributes.background: In the current economic climate, it is morally wrong to use public funds to pay for the restoration of such buildings as Wentworth Woodhouse and Buckingham Palace. The owners of said properties should be the ones to pay and the money earmarked for this should be passed on to the NHS immediately.

attributes.action: Reduce teachers stress by limiting teaching contact hours to maximum 18hrs/ week
attributes.background: There have been many reports that teachers face too much stress and increasing workloads are reducing, not only the quality of teaching, but the mental health of our educators. Planning and assessing takes time. Teachers currently teach upto 25.5 hours which is too much with other duties needed.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 study showed that 89% of 3500 teachers stated that workloads are a problem with 2/3 stating they are considering leaving. Teachers are not given a good work-life balance and often work at home because they do not have enough time to complete all tasks in normal working hours- with most reporting they work 60+ hrs /wk.  Teachers are currently expected to teach 25.5 hrs/wk. By legally reducing this to 18 classroom hours we can reduce stress and allow a more reasonable work week for teachers

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: I want to stop housing developers selling new build houses as leaseholds
attributes.background: I want the big house builders to stop selling houses as leaseholds. This is adding costs to home buyers and making their houses difficult to re-sell and expensive to maintain. Unlike Flats there is no Legal need to adopt this practice it is purely driven by greed and is an unregulated activity.
attributes.additional_details: Developers have been selling detached and semi-detached houses as leasehold, with clauses which allow the ground rent to double every 10 years. The freeholds are then sold on to private companies which extract the ground rent, charge high fees if a homeowner wishes to make alterations, and refuse to sell the freehold except for a huge premium. Homebuyers have been left with houses they cannot sell as lenders will no longer offer mortgages against them because of the ground rent clauses.

attributes.action: Stop non-medically qualified persons administering dermal filler.
attributes.background: The aesthetics industry is poorly regulated and the number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections in the UK is growing rapidly. Concern lies mainly with theses individual's ability to assess appropriately as well as recognise and manage complications as and when they arise.
attributes.additional_details: Health professionals in the U.K are concerned about the growing number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections. Anyone can train, get insurance and start injecting members of the public with these substances. There are substantial risks associated with these treatments and whilst doctors and nurses are regulated by their own professional bodies, non-medics are not. They are not regulated or professionally accountable.

attributes.action: Stop aid to countries that have a nuclear/space program put monies saved in NHS
attributes.background: Billions are sent abroad to foreign countries that have nuclear or space programs or both. And our own NHS doesnt have enough funds to survive. Pakistan received over £300.000.0000 from the UK whilst spending millions on their space and nuclear ambitions. Let's readjust and help our NHS .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-34176846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-12607537
http://news.sky.com/story/ae-departments-fail-to-hit-waiting-times-for-16-months-nhs-figures-show-10725757

attributes.action: Postpone notice under art.50 until the question on revocation has been answered.
attributes.background:
The question as to whether notice under art.50 can be revoked once issued remains open, however a definitive answer to this question would be useful to allow MPs to make constructive decisions on the exit process.

A case currently before the High Court in Ireland is addressing this very question.
attributes.additional_details:
This would not be going against the result of the referendum, but would simply allow for Parliament to have the information it needs to properly consider its position and its options and whether a future vote on a proposed deal will be truly meaningful.

Those advocating leaving the EU have waited years for this moment. Waiting a little longer for Parliament to have the information required to consider its options is in the interests of our democracy.

attributes.action: Abolish Bedroom Tax on all Council Properties
attributes.background: This Bedroom Tax is affecting thousands of families all across the UK, when it was originally imposed there was a lot of debate to abolish it and yet this has not been done.
attributes.additional_details:
This affects everyone living in social housing; disabled, welfare recipients, and those who work. If you live in a council property and have any spare bedrooms, you will be forced to pay the tax whatever your personal situation may be; even if you have lived in that property for up to 22 years. 

The government has decided that:

* Any single person aged 16 or over needs their own bedroom.
* A couple need a bedroom.
* A child needs a bedroom BUT.....
* A boy and a girl are expected to share a bedroom if they are both under 10.
* 2 boys or 2 girls are expected to share if they are both under 16. See below for examples.
* Foster children are not taken into account 
* Children who stay with you part of the time aren’t taken into account.

attributes.action: Pay sick pay to employees who have been in service for more than 2 years
attributes.background: I am a reliable employee who only takes time off when I am genuinely too ill to get to work but will still go in when I'm too unwell to because I do not get sick pay. Yes I'm entitled to SSP but I would have to be off work for more than for days and it doesn't cover my wages.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been at this work post for 4 years and am a reliable, honest and hard working person. I feel it unfair that I and others in my situation do not have our salary protected for a certain number of weeks a year and are forced to either go in to work sick, have our salary compromised or take more time that is required off just to claim SSP, which I have only ever done once. 
I would like to see employers be made to offer sick pay/salary protection to employees in service for over 2 years

attributes.action: Revise/Abolish stamp duty rules for first-time property buyers.
attributes.background: First time buyers (FTBs) should not have to pay stamp duty, the legacy agreement whereby this tax was relieved for FTBs should be reinstated. This would alleviate the financial challenges that FTBs face when attempting to get on the housing ladder which is further exacerbated in the South East
attributes.additional_details: There have been Government schemes introduced that are supposed to offset/assist FTBs entering the market however these are grossly prejudice to the London area and elsewhere in the UK. Outer Fringe areas of London have inflated housing markets due to their attractive location for commuting but schemes like the Help-to-Buy & Save-to-Buy have limits of £250,000 which is significantly below the average house price in areas such as Essex.

attributes.action: Make "critical thinking" a mandatory subject in secondary school.
attributes.background: Critical thinking skills will allow the UK populous to improve their decision making process. Making critical thinking mandatory in schools will lead to future generations being better equipped to question what they are told in terms of facts and feasibility.
attributes.additional_details: The National Council for Excellence in Critical Thinking defines critical thinking as the "intellectually disciplined process of actively and skillfully conceptualizing, applying, analyzing, synthesizing, and/or evaluating information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action."

attributes.action: “That there shall be an early parliamentary general election.”
attributes.background: To remedy the uncertainty caused by the outcome of the Referendum on U. K. membership of the European Union, that the House of Commons have a motion laid before it by the end of March 2017 “That there shall be an early parliamentary general election.”
attributes.additional_details: The Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011 provides for this, and if passed by a two-thirds majority, it is the only way for a general election to be held earlier than May 2020, other than a motion of no confidence in HMG passed by a simple majority.

attributes.action: Allow enlisted men to bear arms around the clock for personal protection in UK
attributes.background:
Our serving military should be allowed to carry sidearms at all times for self defense and for national security so they may act without hesitation to any terrorist threat to themselves or our nation
Our military are trained and are under oath to serve and protect our nation!
Please sign and share
attributes.additional_details:
No more attacks on our protectors like the horrific killing of Fusilier Lee Rigby RIP
Stop the attempted abductions of our serving men and women.
Give our heros the chance to protect themselves along with protecting our nation.

attributes.action: Abolish or reduce Vehicle Excise Duty (Road Tax) for Motorcycles
attributes.background: As most Motorcycles cover minimal annual mileage, have low emissions, help reduce congestion and do little damage to roads, it is unfair that owners have to pay between £17 and £82 tax per year whilst a significant number of cars pay none and many paying only £30 per year.

attributes.action: Make learning and understanding about disabilities part of the curriculum.
attributes.background: As a mother of a young child who has Autism it's a topic close to my heart. We will encounter people from all backgrounds around the world in life that will have a disability. Teaching our youth of today about disabilities and how we are all equal instead of growing up with no knowledge/awareness.
attributes.additional_details: In current curriculum there's areas that need a helping hand. I'm sure that many will agree that there's alot of unhelpful information you received that didn't really help you in 'real' life. By signing this petition your giving people who haven't got a voice a chance to push for a cause that I feel should have always been in place. Why aren't we made aware of disabilities and how we can help others. "Bless those that see the world through a different window and those who understand their view"

attributes.action: The UK government should not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.background: The US administration has put forward the climate change denying America First Energy Policy.  Until such time as this policy is reversed and they take clear and measurable steps to reduce C02 emissions the UK must not enter into any trade negotiations with the USA.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.whitehouse.gov/america-first-energy

attributes.action: Delay the April 2017 VED (Car Tax) changes until a better idea is proposed
attributes.background: The 2017 changes will damage the car industry and buyer of both new and used cars from April 2017. The changes do nothing to encourage manufacturers to improve efficiency and do nothing to encourage buyers to buy more fuel and emissions efficient cars. Changes are a retrograde step
attributes.additional_details:
The details of the new rates are available on gov website - https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/534511/ved-reform-briefing-for-motor-industry.pdf
This change increases costs for drivers ;
First year tax from £0 for cars between 1 and 130g/km CO2 to between £10 and £160.  
It increases annual cost for these cars from £20-£110 to £140 for all
Adds a £310 premium on top where list price is over £40,000. This lasts 5 years so affects the used car market also.

attributes.action: Review the lack of increases in Carers Allowance for full time carers.
attributes.background:
According to a recent survey, carried out by the Carers Trust, caring for sick and/or disabled family members is taking its toll on the health of the nations unpaid carers.

This is going to lead to a care crisis in this country as well as be a massive drain on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
A carer needs to look after someone for a minimum 35 hours a week, in order, to receive Carers Allowance of £62.10, that`s just £1.78 an hour or less which is far below the National Living Wage and has not been increased the way pensions have.

With the effect of Austerity policies meaning that financial support for carers in the form of Council Tax and Housing benefit having been slashed we are now struggling to survive and we're forced back into part-time work to survive.

We need action now.

attributes.action: Stop ALL spending by UK Gov on Foreign Aid and divert it to the Care Budget.
attributes.background: We can't afford to look after our own citizens, but still send money overseas, why?  We must no longer neglect our own citizens, who worked hard to build our country and paid into the very same system that now neglects them but sends money to countries that do not need it!
attributes.additional_details: Raising council tax to pay for care, when it will not be enough or guaranteed to actually be spent wisely on care (that's if it gets into the care pot at all!).  We need to focus on those that paid into the system and look at the ways we should be working with everyone in our communities to integrate care and develop more beneficial caring environments for the future benefit of all.

attributes.action: stop funding the royal family with taxpayers money
attributes.background: the royal family is one of the wealthiest in the world. Whilst I don't wish to be disrespectful to HRH we should stop or at least suspend payments from the civil list
attributes.additional_details: many people are going hungry, living out of food banks, having to choose between rent, food or heating. homelessness has risen to an all time high. front line services are strapped for cash. the british tax payer can no longer afford to fund the lavish lifestyle of one of the wealthiest families in the world.

attributes.action: Expand the Syrian refugee resettlement programme and increase aid.
attributes.background: The government should increase its pledge to resettle 20 000 Syrian refugees by 2020 as well as increase aid to help millions affected by the crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
While several Middle-Eastern nations have taken in millions of Syrian refugees, as well European countries such as Germany taking in hundreds of thousands so far, the UK government has pledged to resettle only 20 000, by 2020.

The US president has signed an executive order to ban Syrian refugees indefinitely, which will likely result in civilian deaths that could be avoided. One of the best responses from the UK to show its opposition would be to increase its pledge and increase aid.

attributes.action: Include the dangers of online grooming in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I would like children to be taught about the dangers of online grooming alongside their learning about IT and computers. Paedophiles use the internet to groom young people, but currently this isn't taught in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Children should be made aware of the dangers around online grooming, and it should be made a part of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be allowed with a specific liecence per event
attributes.background:
Fireworks can cause injury to bystanders.  
Fireworks cause distress people's pets. 
Fireworks should only be ignited by a pyrotechnics person.
Fireworks should not be allowed on private property they should only be allowed in a designated public area with a specific license per event.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the risks fireworks bring it is requested that they are only ignited by a professional pyrotechnics person.  They should only be allowed in designated public places. They should require a licence from the local council. This will safe guard children and animals and ensure this safety risk and noise pollution is managed in a fair socially considered manner

attributes.action: Stop HS2 tunnel plan in Longsight Manchester
attributes.background: As a Longsight resident, I have not received information about how the tunnel affects me or what my rights are. Speaking to other residents they feel the same. The impact of this on people's lives and future plans if they end of selling has to be reviewed and the plans on the HS2 tunnel halted.

attributes.action: Ensure  the UK can trade tariff free in the EU single market after Brexit
attributes.background: It is vital for jobs and UK prosperity that the UK does not cut off the inportant markets of the EU to UK business after Brexit. Our Financial services are the backbone of our economy and must have full passporting rights going forward. The industrial sector too must not be penalised for Brexit

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for young adults under the age of 18
attributes.background: The minimum wage being £3.87 for 16 and 17 year olds can not only put young people off working, but also reduces their financial independence. It should be raised to at least £4.50 so these under 18 year olds can get a worthwhile and rewarding payment for their labour time.

attributes.action: To give assistant/therapy dogs the same recognition as Guide and Hearing dogs.
attributes.background: Guide/Hearing Dogs are recognised by shops to give them admission. However, therapy and assistance don't have the rights to enter establishments with those they support, this disadvantages the person the dog is with. I am looking to give these useful dogs the same recognition in law.

attributes.action: Implement the recommendations of the Cttee on Economic, Social & Cultural Rights
attributes.background: The UN Committee on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights issued a damning report on the UK’s compliance with international human rights law, and made 60 specific recommendations. The government must explain to Parliament and the British public how it intends to implement them.
attributes.additional_details:
The government missed the opportunity of the 2016 Autumn statement to start decisively allocating the necessary resources to fulfil the economic and social rights recognised in international human rights law. 

Find out more background information here: http://www.just-fair.co.uk/2016-concluding-observations

The UK’s human rights record will be reviewed again in the UN Universal Periodic Review in May 2017.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cars to pass horses at no more than 15mph
attributes.background: There is an increase in the number of tragic accidents caused by vehicles passing horses far too quickly and not allowing sufficient room to pass.   This can be reduced by making it a legal requirement for vehicles to pass slow and wide.

attributes.action: BRING BACK THE NIT NURSE
attributes.background: We all know that the little critters are at large within schools. But they have got significantly worse over recent years. Bringing back the nit nurse would give those parents who don't regularly check their children's hair the extra push they need.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair on all children involved. I myself have had to treat my daughter 3 times in the 2 weeks she's been back at school. This is almost abuse. Let's help all people involved.

attributes.action: For the UK to remain a full member of the single market
attributes.background: The petition calls on Parliament not to permit the Prime Minster to invoke Article 50 unless the government promises to negotiate for full membership of the single market

attributes.action: Remove all American military bases from UK soil.
attributes.background: A relic of the second world war, the UK is littered with underused American military bases, thousands of acres of beautiful UK countryside is being left to waste with no advantage to the UK at all, it's just waste land, not even wildlife is welcome.
attributes.additional_details:
The United States has thousands of acres of UK soil for their own military use which is of very little advantage to us, they provide minimal economic benefits or defence as they are self sufficient and more likely to attract enemies to our shores.
 These bases are generally in prime locations and could be used in countless ways to boost our economy, housing, farming or simply given back to nature to enhance our countryside. American military bases are of no use to the UK, take our country back.

attributes.action: Mandate ethnic diversity in jury selection where minorities are defendants.
attributes.background: The view that currently underpins jury policy in England & Wales is that a randomly selected jury is most likely to be representative and therefore most likely to be impartial. However several studies have shown that it is in the nature of random selection that some juries will be unrepresentative.
attributes.additional_details:
This particularly applies to cases involving defendants from ethnic minorities. Random selection from a populous where 87.2% of people are white, naturally results in a high likelihood of white-only juries. This raises conflicts in cultural norms and community values. Parliament needs to ensure that this imbalance is removed and one is judged by 'a jury of their peers' to preserve equality, fairness and overall confidence in our legal system.

https://goo.gl/vZxgqS
https://goo.gl/EbKEld

attributes.action: Scrap the idea to hand over maintenance responsibility from Network Rail to TOCs
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government announced[1] a decision to instead of having a state run company maintaining Britain's rail network to instead hand over the responsibility to private TOC's. Her Majesty's Government has previously privatized the maintenance with disastrous results[2][3][4]
attributes.additional_details:
[1] http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/02/exclusive-network-rail-stripped-control-britains-train-tracks/

[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bexley_railway_station#History

[3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatfield_rail_crash#Cause

[4]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potters_Bar_rail_accidents#2002

attributes.action: Government should stage a new cultural Festival of Britain
attributes.background: The Opening Ceremonies of the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games did much to tell the world what makes Britain Great.  Let's have a cultural Festival of Britain in this post Brexit climate to demonstrate what an amazing nation this is and that we continue to welcome the world
attributes.additional_details: Let's celebrate what makes this nation great in the ways that we did over 2012. Let's reach out and show the world what a vibrant and amazing country we live in, what we have to give to the world through culture and the wider creative sectors which lie at the heart of our thriving knowledge economy
